OpenZeppelin's AccessControl, Pausable, and ReentrancyGuard for robust permissions and security","events":{"DepositLimitUpdated(uint256)":{"params":{"newLimit":"The new deposit limit"}},"Deposited(address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens deposited","total":"The total deposits after the deposit is made","user":"The address of the user making the deposit"}},"EmergencyWithdrawal(address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens withdrawn in an emergency","total":"The total deposits after the emergency withdrawal is made","user":"The address of the user making the emergency withdrawal"}},"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this. _Available since v3.1._"},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."},"Withdrawn(address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens withdrawn","total":"The total deposits after the withdrawal is made","user":"The address of the user making the withdrawal"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"constructor":{"params":{"_depositLimit":"The maximum deposit per address","_token":"The address of the ERC-20 token to be accepted"}},"deposit(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens to deposit"}},"getMyBalance()":{"returns":{"_0":"The caller's current vault balance"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"grantVaultRole(bytes32,address)":{"params":{"account":"The address to assign the role to","role":"The role to grant (INVESTOR_ROLE, AUDITOR_ROLE, etc.)"}},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"recoverERC20(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens to recover","tokenAddress":"The address of the token to be recovered"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeVaultRole(bytes32,address)":{"params":{"account":"The address to remove the role from","role":"The role to revoke"}},"setDepositLimit(uint256)":{"params":{"newLimit":"New deposit limit in token units"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"viewBalance(address)":{"params":{"account":"The address to check the balance of"},"returns":{"_0":"The balance of the specified address"}},"withdraw(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of tokens to withdraw"}}},"title":"SecureVault - A secure, role-based token vault with deposit limits and emergency deposit is made"},"EmergencyWithdrawal(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Event for when an emergency withdrawal is made"},"Withdrawn(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Event for when a withdrawal is made"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"constructor":{"notice":"Initializes the vault with the token address and deposit limit"},"deposit(uint256)":{"notice":"Deposit tokens into the (investor-only)"},"grantVaultRole(bytes32,address)":{"notice":"Grants a role to an account (admin only)"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pauses deposit and withdrawal token)"},"revokeVaultRole(bytes32,address)":{"notice":"Revokes a role from an account (admin only)"},"setDepositLimit(uint256)":{"notice":"Updates the deposit limit per node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x447a5f3ddc18419d41ff92b3773fb86471b1db25773e07f877f548918a185bf1","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://be161e54f24e5c6fae81a12db1a8ae87bc5ae1b0ddc805d82a1440a68455088f","dweb:/ipfs/QmP7C3CHdY9urF4dEMb9wmsp1wMxHF6nhA2yQE5SKiPAdy"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe4455ac1eb7fc497bb7402579e7b4d64d928b846fce7d2b6fde06d366f21c2b3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://cc8841b3cd48ad125e2f46323c8bad3aa0e88e399ec62acb9e57efa7e7c8058c","dweb:/ipfs/QmSqE4mXHA2BXW58deDbXE8MTcsL5JSKNDbm23sVQxRLPS"]},"node_modules/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/SignedMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf92515413956f529d95977adc9b0567d583c6203fc31ab1c23824c35187e3ddc","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c50fcc459e49a9858b6d8ad5f911295cb7c9ab57567845a250bf0153f84a95c7","dweb:/ipfs/QmcEW85JRzvDkQggxiBBLVAasXWdkhEysqypj9EaB6H2g6"]}},"version":1}

params._token: The address of the ERC-20 token to be accepted

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.account: The address to assign the role to
params.role: The role to grant (INVESTOR_ROLE, AUDITOR_ROLE, etc.)

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to recover
params.tokenAddress: The address of the token to be recovered

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.account: The address to remove the role from

params.newLimit: New deposit limit in token units

params.account: The address to check the balance of

returns._0: The balance of the specified address

params.amount: The amount of tokens to withdraw

constructor.notice: Initializes the vault with the token address and deposit limit

emergencyWithdraw().notice: Emergency withdraw only works when paused and investor has funds

getMyBalance().notice: Returns the balance of the caller (investor-only)

grantVaultRole(bytes32,address).notice: Grants a role to an account (admin only)

recoverERC20(address,uint256).notice: Allows admin to recover any ERC-20 tokens mistakenly sent to the vault (excluding the vault token)

revokeVaultRole(bytes32,address).notice: Revokes a role from an account (admin only)

setDepositLimit(uint256).notice: Updates the deposit limit per user

viewBalance(address).notice: Allows auditors to view the balance of an address
